title: The 24 Best Ski Suits to Stay Warm (and Chic) on the Mountain
description: Former Olympic skier Kiley McKinnon gives us her tips for finding ski gear that’s as functional as it is fashionable.
excerpt: We’ve enlisted former Olympic skier Kiley McKinnon to help us break down their favorite ski suits with the best form, function, and fashion.

html:
Halfdays x Ilia Lawrence Jacket

McKinnon co-founded Halfdays with her partner, Ariana Ferwerda, in pursuit of ski gear that was designed specifically for women, in the proportions and colors women like to wear. Even as an Olympian, McKinnon never felt comfortable in her ski uniform, a feeling that led her to pursue better—and more stylish—options. “Really having something that fits your body well is just something that I’d always been looking for,” she says. “And then on top of that, of course, our product is really technical as well.”

The Lawrence Jacket was reimagined in a soft rose hue, thanks to a collaboration with Ilia. It’s insulated without being too outrageously puffy but light enough to wear with additional layers underneath. Plus, numerous inside and outside pockets make it ideal for toting around the ski day necessities: your phone, ski pass, chapstick, snacks, and Kleenex.

Colors: Lip

Shop the matching Alessandra pant.

Zara Recco Technology Jumpsuit

Yes, you can get an utterly stylish and affordable ski suit. Need proof? Just take a look at this under-$200 option from Zara. Plus, this features RECCO technology, which is what rescue professionals would use in case of an accident, should they need to find you and help you down the mountain.

Sizes: XS-XL

Colors: Black, White

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Cordova Ajax Quilted Down Ski Suit

A powder blue suit to take on the best ski resort’s powder—fitting, no? The silhouette of this ski suit alone is worth a ’gram-worthy snap, and it might be one of the most stylish options to sport when you walk into that ski-in restaurant.

Sizes: 2-12

Colors: Haze

GSOU Snow One Piece Outdoor Sports Jumpsuit

To no one’s surprise, you can get a quality ski suit straight from Amazon. It’s a top-rated style that has rave reviews about discussing how great it looks on and, more importantly, how warm it is.

Sizes: XS-XL

Colors: 22 options

Customer review: “I just received this, and just from trying it on, I know I’m gonna love it!!! the color and the style are super cute. It’s more of a slimming fit compared to the rest of the ski stuff I own, which I LOVE because I hate feeling so bulky while skiing. The quality feels thick and durable. My concern with getting one of these was that they looked thinner than full ski jackets, however after 5 minutes of wearing it, I was starting to feel very warm. Feels very well insulated, so I think it will definitely keep me warm. Definitely great value.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Bogner Ellya Ski Jacket

You want to hit the slopes in style—we get it. And if you haven’t already heard, animal print is one of the biggest fashion trends of the season. Combine that with Bogner’s expert craftmanship (which happens to include its Thermore Ecodown to keep you extra warm and dry), this is a head-turning ski suit you’ll keep in your collection for years.

Sizes: XS-3XL

Colors: Brown/Beige

Shop the matching Maren Ski Pants.

The North Face Freedom Insulated Bibs

Want a foolproof ski bib that you know will get you through the toughest runs? Try these plus-sized insulated bibs, which feature adjustable suspenders for the perfect fit.

Sizes: XS-3X

Colors: White Dune, Forest Olive, Midnight mauve/Dragon Fruit, Black

Customer review: “I just spent a few days skiing at Mont Tremblant. I can’t say enough good things about these ski bibs. They are comfortable and warm. I also love the pockets!”

Shop the matching Freedom Insulated Jacket.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Fusalp Kira Ski Suit

Who doesn’t love a chic nod to the ’80s? Fusalp’s ski suit feels both modern and classic. This features the brand’s softshell material, which means it’ll feel like a cloud while also keeping you warm and dry.

Sizes: 36-42

Colors: Marin & Racing

Perfect Moment Tignes II Houndstooth Ski Suit

Sometimes, a tried-and-true classic, fitted ski suit is all you need. This one features an incredibly flattering silhouette that’ll make you look like the most stylish person on the ski lift. Of course, it also has functional features like a pocket for your ski pass, thermal fleece lining, and two zip-front pockets.

Sizes: XS-XL

Colors: Houndstooth Black/Black, Houndstooth Black/Snow White, Wavy Star Print Black/Snow White

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Mackage Miakim Two-Tone Ski Suit

For the girls who want to channel their inner Sporty Spice, this is the option for you. Mackage’s Miakim ski suit has all the bells and whistles you’d want in a standard option, but the standout feature is the padded knees—and for anyone who finds themselves snowboarding, you know that’s a serious must.

Sizes: XXS-XL

Colors: Black

Erin Snow Clio Suit

Anyone who loves ethical fashion will appreciate Erin Snow’s Clio suit, which is made with conscious materials like 100 percent recycled nylon waterproof fabric and 100 percent post-consumer PET. It also features functional details like an insulated over-helmet hood and wrist gaiters with thumb holes—and on top of that, it just looks good.

Sizes: 0-12

Colors: Mist, Black, Smoke

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Jet Set Magic Ghoster Embroidered Ski Suit

With embroidered stars on the sleeves, this ski suit will make you feel like the coolest one in line for the lift. It also features a fleece insert in the collar and the hood, so you’ll be feeling cozy the entire time you’re making those runs.

Sizes: 2-12

Colors: Black

Moncler Grenoble Grenoble Ski Suit

When it comes to luxury brands that do skiwear well, Moncler is one of the best in the business. This chic baby pink ski suit features a hidden front zipper closure for easy in-and-out access, an adjustable belt, and thumbhole cuffs, which will definitely come in handy as you make your way down the slopes.

Sizes: XS-L

Colors: Pink

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Whitespace High Waisted Bib Pant

For the coolest kids on the mountain, there’s the recently launched apparel and gear from Shaun White’s namesake brand, Whitespace. If you’re a bib lover, you’ll find you can wade these bad boys through deep powder without a smidge of seepage.

Sizes: XS-XL

Colors: Lilac Purple, Warm White, Black

Customer review: “These fit like a dream and are very well made. (My only complaint is the lack of size zippers for easy bathroom breaks.) The fabric is nice, plenty of range of motion, the inside lining is nice. Haven’t worn them snowboarding yet. Small fits great (5'2" 120lbs)”

Shop the matching Cropped Puffer Jacket.

Burton Avalon GORE-TEX 2L Bib Pants

When in doubt, you can’t go wrong with a brand like Burton, which is known for its snow apparel and gear. This bib features GORE-TEX technology, which means it’ll withstand the elements and keep you protected from them, too.

Sizes: XXS-2XL

Colors: True Black, Amparo Blue, Forest Night, Sun Dried Tomato, Stout White

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Rudsak Love Ski Suit with Faux Fur Collar

For all the style that this ski suit holds (which is a lot, we must say!), there’s also function. This suit features quilted knee padding and a high-loft down fill, which means you won’t have to worry about staying warm. Plus, there are faux fur and leather details for an added touch of luxury.

Sizes: XS-XL

Colors: Black

Head Sportswear Legacy Hooded Down Snowsuit

Head Sportswear’s Legacy collection is made in partnership with alpine ski racer Lindsey Vonn, so you know this was made with functionality at the front of mind. Add a sleek, sporty sense of style to it, and you have this sage green snowsuit.

Sizes: 4-14

Colors: Granite Green

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Goldbergh Goldbergh Bowy Down Jacket

Goldbergh has a way of making ski attire that feels distinctly feminine and undeniably sophisticated (and the brand was featured in the latest season of Emily in Paris, if that gives you an idea of just how chic it can be!). With the cinched waist and the bow detail, you might even find yourself wearing this jacket after the ski trip, too.

Sizes: 2-10

Colors: Black

Shop the matching Pippa Cropped Ski Pants.

Brunello Cucinelli Bonded Techno Fabric Mountain Jumpsuit

Few things compare to the luxury of Brunello Cucinelli—and yes, that includes the brand’s collection of skiwear. This lined bib features zippered cuffs and inner gaiters at the hem, a zip front closure for accessibility, and attached suspenders, which will keep everything in place.

Sizes: 38-42

Colors: Snow

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Aztech Mountain Bella High-Rise Ski Pants

For those who prefer to ski with a bib rather than pants, consider these salopettes. They’re not only stylish but functional too, with a cutout ventilation detail on the back, so you don’t have to think about the possibility of overheating.

Sizes: 2-10

Colors: Castilleja

Shop the matching Minnie Nuke Suit Down Ski Jacket.

Yves Salomon Pantalon Snowsuit

Maybe you don’t want to deal with the fuss of pulling your pantlegs over your ski or snowboard boots. Lucky for you, this Yves Salomon snowsuit exists.

Sizes: XS-XL

Colors: Black

Shop the matching Shearling-Trimmed Ski Jacket.
